record.field: Sentiment analysis
Analyze the sentiment of the conversation (positive, neutral, negative) based on the transcript.
Key words
Identify the key words and phrases that are frequently repeated in this conversation.
Monologue duration
Which participants spoke the longest, and what topics did they emphasize?
Problem areas identification
Highlight moments in the conversation where the customer expressed dissatisfaction or asked critical questions.
Satisfaction level
Assess the customer's level of satisfaction based on the transcript context.
Pause analysis
Where were the long pauses in the conversation, and what preceded them?
Topic switching
Identify how often the topics of discussion changed during the conversation.
Objection analysis
Identify the customer's objections and how the agent responded to them.
Agent effectiveness
How did the agent address the customer's issues, and how quickly did they offer a solution?
Request identification
What were the main requests or tasks the customer asked the agent to handle?
Improvement recommendations
Analyze the transcript and suggest recommendations for improving customer communication.
Conversation closure analysis
How did the conversation end? Was the customer satisfied with the resolution?
Speech pattern analysis
What speech patterns did the agent use to support the customer?
Mood change analysis
How did the customer’s mood change throughout different stages of the conversation?
Emotional tension analysis
Highlight moments when the conversation became tense.
Lexical analysis
Did the agent use professional terminology or simplified language when speaking with the customer?
Customer requests
What specific products or services did the customer mention during the conversation?
Response speed analysis
Analyze the agent’s response time to the customer’s requests.
Script_adherence
Did the agent follow a pre-prepared script or improvise?
Closing phrases analysis
What closing phrases did the agent use to end the conversation?
Customer pain points
What pain points or frustrations did the customer express during the conversation?
Active listening
Did the agent demonstrate active listening techniques, such as paraphrasing or summarizing the customer's statements?
Customer trust
Assess the level of trust the customer displayed towards the agent during the conversation.
Agent empathy
Identify moments where the agent demonstrated empathy towards the customer’s situation.
Politeness and professionalism
Analyze how polite and professional the agent was throughout the conversation.
Customer decision making cues
Identify verbal cues that indicate whether the customer was close to making a decision.
Escalation detection
Were there any moments where the conversation escalated into conflict or needed managerial intervention?
Tone consistency
Was the agent's tone of voice consistent throughout the conversation, or did it shift at certain points?
Solution delivery
How effectively did the agent deliver the proposed solution to the customer's issue?
customer engagement
Assess how engaged the customer was during the conversation based on the length and depth of their responses.
Interruptions and overlaps
Identify instances where the agent or customer interrupted each other and analyze their impact on the conversation.
Customer loyalty indicators
Look for any indications in the transcript that suggest customer loyalty or intent to return.
Agent adaptability
How well did the agent adapt to unexpected questions or issues raised by the customer?
First call resolution
Did the agent resolve the customer's issue in this call, or were follow-up actions required?
Customer feedback requests
Did the agent ask for feedback from the customer at the end of the conversation?
Follow up suggestions
Based on the transcript, what follow-up actions should the agent take after this call?
upselling opportunities
Were there opportunities for the agent to offer additional products or services, and were they utilized?
Clarity of communication
Was the agent clear and concise in their explanations, or were there any misunderstandings?
Emotional intelligence
Assess how well the agent managed the customer’s emotions throughout the conversation.
Persuasion techniques
What persuasion techniques, if any, did the agent use to influence the customer’s decision?
Agent confidence
How confident did the agent appear in offering solutions or providing information to the customer?
Customer frustration signals
Identify any verbal or non-verbal signals of frustration from the customer, and how the agent addressed them.
Handling difficult questions
How did the agent handle challenging or difficult questions from the customer?
Tone matching
Did the agent match the customer’s tone, and how did this affect the outcome of the conversation?
Expectation management
How well did the agent manage the customer’s expectations regarding service or product delivery?
Value proposition delivery
Analyze how effectively the agent communicated the value proposition of the product or service.
Agent knowledge
How knowledgeable did the agent appear regarding the product or service discussed in the conversation?
Customer intent identification
Was the customer’s intent to purchase, inquire, or resolve an issue clear during the conversation?
Listening for opportunities
Did the agent listen for and identify opportunities to build rapport or strengthen the customer relationship?
Cross selling opportunities
Did the conversation reveal opportunities to suggest related products or services that were relevant to the customer’s needs?
